review_header: Great Place to Hang Out; The Tea and Muffin were Good too!
review_desc: Stopped in about 10 on a Saturday morning with a friend as we were looking for a good place to sit and chat. This was it. I had very good Moroccan mint tea (free refills) and a pistachio muffin. The seating was plentiful, the service...More

We had such a nice time at Cafe on the Common. Staff is friendly and fast. The coffee is excellent and pastries are, too! Although there's plenty of seating, it was full at noon on Sunday. We found a table, and enjoyed a leisurely talk...More

review_header: Run of the mill alt coffee place
review_desc: Nothing to report here. Your average alt coffee place. Coffee was fine. Food selection limited. Comfortable seating. Okay place to hang out.

I can't say enough good things about this locally-owned cafe, where we have become regulars. We love the food, the beverages, the atmosphere and the staff. Lots of Waltham folks and folks from Brandeis and Bentley use this as a place to meet or a...More

I love any coffee shop I can bring my work and get a great cup of coffee and a baked good. I enjoy the friendly service and the atmosphere of the other customers. Great place I've been to many times. Keep up the good work.
a good first outing of the weekend, good pastries, coffee, sandwiches etc. that first cup of good coffee for the weekend.

A destination coffee shop with an adjoining ice cream shop that I can't wait to try when it warms up! Excellent biscotti, very good coffee, comfy tables and sofas and a friendly clientele. The staff is very welcoming. Check out "Two Priests and a Rabbi",...More

Cafe on the Common is a welcome refuge from the chains when your travels get you to downtown Waltham. Excellent coffee and scones. Friendly service. Old school venue with high ceilings and comfortable seats in a roomy venue. Painful street parking standard fare in Waltham.

This is a great place to hang out with a friend on a rainy afternoon. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Excellent sandwiches and tasty baked goods but I come for the coffee and ambiance. No pretentious names like grande this or that - just...More

review_header: Had a snack and viewed all the goodies and gifts
review_desc: Stopped by to have coffee and home made goodies. There are all kinds of great gifts, clothes, etc. to see. Sally makes sure you have a friendly and informative visit. You will definitely want to go back - I did.

review_header: Tea for Two or Three or Four or Five
review_desc:
Where but in the quiet, magical space created by owner Sally can you escape from
the frenetic pace of the Holiday season. No matter that our group consisted of a
"wiggley" 7 year old boy, an 11 year old boy, a 19 year old young...More

I felt like I had stumbled into a small tea room in Windsor England. Sally, the owner was delighted to welcome us and served us an excellent proper afternoon tea. We each received a pot of our chosen tea. The scones came out first and...More

Went for an afternoon tea, had reservations, yet.......it wasn't bad , yet......Perhaps I had too high of expectations, but I was expecting more from an establishment that is only a Tea Room. I've been to many Tea Rooms on both sides of the Atlantic, search...More

review_header: Wonderful and charming tea shop with great gifts, too.
review_desc: Found this in downtown Waltham. Enjoyed a warm cup of chai and tasty scones, clotted cream and jam, too. Found wonderful "Dr. Who" gifts for my 10-year old daughter and a great "Votes for Women" tea towel as a gift. The proprietress is very involved...More

I visited the tea leaf to take my friend on a fun birthday trip. I'm not much of a tea person but the 3 flavored we tried were great. The apricot black tea and the pomegranate oolong were delish though I would have passed on...More

The Tea Leaf is a hidden gem on Moody Street in Waltham. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it's like stepping into your grandma's house, cozy and cluttered in just the right way. The full tea is delicious and very filling....More

review_header: Great little place to have tea
review_desc: If you are looking for a place to take a young girl for tea, this is the place. It is not as fancy as the Fairmont Hotel but it is also not as expensive. I took my 5 year old great niece and she had...More

This was my first tea, my wife has been before at different locations, I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed the Tea Leaf. The tea leaf was an experience I have never enjoyed before. We started with a pot of tea each, I had...More

I Take my Mom to the Tea Leaf and it is always a great experience. There is a huge assortment of teas, and the food is excellent. The afternoon tea for two is to die for. Sally always comes up with interesting and tasty foods...More

review_header: DD got me hooked on coffee ...
review_desc: I like that it is so dependable . I like to get a bagel or a donut with my coffee. They have some nice new breakfast sandwiches now too.

We go to this DD quite often. The crew is always alert and helpful. The food is always fresh and yummy. Only reason for the 4/5 is because their coffee is not the same quality and consistency is lacking. It is not the fault of...More

review_header: Cant start our day without it! Dunkins: thjat is!
review_desc: The Dunkin" Donuts on Linden Street is fantastic in terms of super fast service, fresh goodies and a very efficient staff who knows exactly what they are going to order unless they opt for a change. The facility is very clean, the on duty managers...More
Very well organized, more than your average D & D's (I have been to many). Full food/coffee menu, professional/friendly service and quick "in & out". I have passed by other D & D's to go to this one.

this store closes at night, where as most in my area are open 24 hrs. a day. i was just looking for a cup of tea. was on the expensive side. was getting ready to close. so there was hardly anything to eat. got my...More

Sorry to say but I don't go to any DD. Donuts absolutely s^*~k. I was a fan favorite of the coffee roles. Weak coffee not what it used to be. Tried a breakfast sandwich one time to many. Easy in easy out. I don't waste...More
I had the bacon egg and cheese on texas toast, my daughter had the same on croissant. tasteless, it tasted like it was boiled or steamed. No flavor to even the bacon.

review_header: Needed my java fix and this Dunkin made it happen!
review_desc: Staying nearby at one of the hotels and needed to have some decent coffee, the flavors and taste of home. Dunkin always deliver that quality coffee that you expect. Their quality control must be so on target because not every McDonald's or Starbuck's taste the...More

The customer service at this Dunkin Donuts was truly outstanding. My order was taken efficiently, the manager came over to provide me with a bag for my items, and my drinks were ready so quickly. Every person working there was wonderful.
Even though they were out of many donuts, the service was very good and they made our stop work out.
We had coffee and pumpkin donuts that were delicious. The staff members were warm and friendly. This is a good place to grab something to drink and order a pastry.

review_header: Looking for Breakfast on Sunday AM
review_desc: In town for wedding. Left our hotel by car in search of breakfast. Restaurant after restaurant was full and it would be at least a 30 min wait. The group consensus was to head back towards the Westin Hotel and find some place open. Dunkin...More

review_header: Franchised, of course, but has a local, friendly feel.
review_desc: I'm not a gigantic fan of Starbucks, and sometimes not even Dunkin', but I haven't been to one in a while and this one sort of rekindled my loyalty, ha. It had friendly staff, a quiet dining room (even though there were many people in...More
This is a typical Dunkin Donuts. Whenever I've been it hasn't been crowded, so service has been quick and there has been seating available. There is plenty of parking.

This is a regular size Dunkin Donuts with the standard DD fare.
Clean coffee shop with seating and plenty of parking.

review_header: Best coffee and ambience in town
review_desc: Wonderful, family-owned and run coffee spot in near-secret location. Use your GPS to find this gem. Comfortable seating upstairs and terrific pastry. Personalized service. The local cops get their coffee here and not particularly at Dunkins.

Hidden at the center of a block, behind the West Newton Cinema, this cafe is a true find. The variety of teas and coffees is outstanding. I just had one of the tastiest bowls of soup, ever -- vegetarian lentil. It was served with a...More

Four of us needed a quick Saturday morning coffee fix and pastry on the way to an event. The reviewer who called this a "hidden gem" was spot on: It is both hidden and a gem. The good part is that our GPS found L'Aroma's...More

review_header: Wonderful coffee, bakery and sandwiches with a Sri Lanken twist
review_desc: We had a wonderful lunch at L'Aroma. Very good coffee, great sandwiches, and terrific curry. All of the Sri Lanken food is fabulous. Very pleasant place to meet for coffee and a pastry.

I favorably reviewed L'Aroma previously as a coffeehouse, but this review is for the food. For breakfast, they have a veggie hash that is absolutely delicious. It consists of eggs of your choice with a mix of roasted peppers, onions, eggplant and root vegetables on...More

This was reviewed in the paper a few months ago and I saved the article. So glad I did! Had a wonderful lunch of greek salad with chicken, corn, romaine, olives and feta. Their chicken curry sandwich was a hit as well. Wonderful ambience and...More

I really love having this place so close to my place. They have solid lattes and mochas, an assortment of hot and cold sandwiches, wraps, and baked goods. They also have a bulk tea assortment upstairs, with favorites like earl grey and chamomile. Bagged and...More

review_header: Nice cappuccino, good space upstairs to work
review_desc: I had a couple of hours to spend in Newton, found this place. I had a large cappuccino which was superbly made. Croissant was very well done too. Nice space to sit and work upstairs with free Wi-Fi.

Everything I have ever ordered here is fantastic - the lattes, teas, baked goods, lunch specials. I have visited L'Aroma 40-50 times. I am regular enough so that Offam knows my name and drink. The upstairs has comfy chairs and small tables. It is easy...More

This is the worst Starbucks around. It's unfortunately the closest to my house, but they are slow, inefficient, and never make anything the way it should be. The staff is always busy socializing- the coffee bar is a a mess and never any straws- why...More

The service here is fantastic. They even gave my pups a special treat on a couple visits! My orders are pretty basic (iced coffee and hot coffee black), but I am always satisfied. The drive-thru does get quite busy, but that is to be expected...More

Located in a parking lot, so parking is great. As this visit was on a weekend, not the crush I experienced on my last visit during the week with all the company business and take outs. My black eye was well made and in a...More

Went to this starbucks and was only person and still had to wait to be served.
The chai latte was made terribly and not hot

review_header: Your typical modern Starbucks. Nice location
review_desc: Nice atmosphere with good variety. I do frequent this place. Great relaxing location. Staff are friendly and the place seems to be well kept clean.

review_header: New Starbucks, Sometimes on the Slower Side
review_desc:
Reserve location with decent selection, but just on the basis of it being newer, some of the new staff are not as expedient as should be yet. But, seems they've brought in some seasoned baristas from other locations to help out.
A bit disappointing the...More
We always buy our Dunkaccino from Dunkin donuts. It is the best place to buy your everyday coffee. Go for it!

i dont go to DD a lot - but needed a sugar fix. got a boston creme and a choc glazed, and a lg coffee - $6.82 (yikes). the boston creme tasted like it was yesterday's donut. the choc glazed was ok. i guess i...More
As all dunkin' donuts, a bagel sandwich and a cup of coffee make perfect breakfast. The price is very good. and you've got free parking.

I stopped by DD last Sunday. After waiting for 25 min for coffee, since they were training someone, I asked for a cappuccino. I was told they could not make it. When I pointed out that I had waited 25 min to hear this, the...More
We were trying to find a post office and it was next to the Dunkin Donuts. I have always liked the coconut doughnut and they had it. I was very glad that we stopped in.

The hot chocolate at L.A. Burdick changed my life. It's incredibly rich (stick with the small) and creamy. I've also had the ginger chocolate loaf, and it's great too. It is expensive, and the little cakes and pastries are expensive to, but it's a nice...More
The spiced dark hot chocolate (size small) and a shared piece of raspberry tart hit the spot. Worth the splurge. I went back to buy chocolate mice and penguins as gifts.

Super yum and super sweet hot chocolate !Reminds me of the hot chocolate I had in the by lanes of interior villages of Switzerland. Also super sweet staff!
Have expensive hand made chocolates too
The absolute BEST hot chocolate and assortment of chocolates! The quality of the chocolates is superb. An obligatory stop when visiting Boston!

review_header: Chocolate lover's great escape in Cambridge winters
review_desc: For those of you who love chocolate, hot or cold, or melted or candied...this is the place for you. This quaint shop right on Brattle Street near Harvard Square is a must visit, especially during a long, dreary winter. The hot chocolate (dark, milk and...More

Burdick's is a wonderful treat and full of little long-tailed surprises. The chocolate is amazing. And what they do with it is even more fantastic.
Hot chocolate on a cold evening...

Ok I'm not a fan of chocolate or hot chocolate but thought I'd try this place out given the good reviews. It's a lil pricey but you get what you pay for. Hot chocolate was rich and satisfying....can't say I've tasted many others to be...More

review_header: Delicious pit stop in Cambridge or Back Bay
review_desc: LA Burdicks is delectable! Very rich drinking chocolate in charming shops. Stay for some drinking chocolate but be sure to take home some truffles or specialty pieces!

The price is way out there for these delights, and everything there is worth every penny.
Don't leave without trying the spiced hot chocolate.

review_header: A comfort during the Bomb Cyclone
review_desc: Classy coffee bar with gourmet chocolates and hand baked treats with a quiet, academic, casual vibe. Only get a small box of 4 truffles if you're trying the chocolate (pricey at $9). One small bite of spicy chocolate ganache truffle lingers in your mouth. Heaven!...More
This is how coffee shops should be. Great variety of coffees with quick service. Always visit when in town. Like the outside seating however only in the summer.
didn't work for me because, although i went there several times in the past, I never had the feeling that the staff really knew or cared about customer service and the food was definitely meh.
If you want to try the very, best, world-class coffee, go here. Absolutely amazing results from the best beans, roasting, equipment, and care in making. The best.

Really great little local coffee shop in downtown Newtonville. The only downside is that it's a super tiny space so it's not guaranteed you will get to sit (which is why I only gave it 4 stars) but everything else about it is great.

Thank Goodness you opened!!!! The Starbucks around the corner is horrible! Your scones are fabulous as is your coffee! Your staff is typically friendly and welcoming and happy to answer my questions. My only complaint is that it is sometimes hard to get a seat,...More

Newtonville was lacking a place like George Howell. The coffee is excellent, as are their pastries. The scones are delicious. The service is friendly and much more helpful than the Starbucks around the corner, which often has a much longer line. My only complaint is...More

Their coffee is really good. I was told the story of the owner creating his chain of shops and hand-picking certain brands of coffee, selling it to Starbucks, opening new stores, etc. For what it's worth these business adventures did not hurt the quality but...More
Friendly neighbourhood place . I find coffee smoother and richer than either Starbucks or Peets.. Cost a little bit more but well worth it. Also has very friendly staff .

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: As with all Starbucks the coffee is overpriced and not all that good. This location is unusual in that it handles the usual Marriott express store. They offer all kinds of snack items along with the traditional knick knacks. We did buy a couple of...More

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: Coffee ready to go with some ice snacks to tide you over until lunch. Grab and go to either your meeting or checkout.

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: overpriced on certain items limited coffee items on hand service from employees was great coffee was great .

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: Nice people work at this Starbucks location. Good coffee! It is in the lobby between the restaurant and the elevators. The woman who waited on us was very nice and answered my questions about the area.

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: The coffee is starbucks and is very hot, has most of the extras except vanilla powder,but service was great.

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: A lobby kiosk, the service was fast and menu was like a min Starbucks. Good pastry, great coffee and ultra convenient. You can head out, or take it back to the room so it works on the go or if you are staying onsite.

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: Highly recommended. Appreciated the service and overall delivery. Overall a nice little café servicing the guests as soon as they come out.

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: Slow service, weak tea, but at least it's convenient. Maybe there are other options in the Marriott to consider....

Name_of_restaurant: Coffee Kiosk at Boston Marriott Newton
review_desc: It was very convenient and I got my Chai Latte Fix. Cons: The drink was WAY too hot that I had to wait at least 30 mins. to begin drinking it. And, it was still very hot. I accidentally burnt the inside of my mouth...More

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: A cosy cafe with excellent coffee and loose leaf tea, sandwiches, and delicious cookies and little cakes!

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: Wandering around Harvard and generally Cambridge can wear you down a bit. The coffee s here good, workers generally very cheerful and there is a constant bustle. I walked by twice in my early morning wanderings, and given the crowds, figured it had to be...More

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: A little hyped place I think, a little too loud for a discussion, crowded & congested.The cheese sandwich was okay not hot,the hot chocolate was tasty but cold.A good place to hang out with friends though.Their brownie too sweet!

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: What a sweet vibe this place has! Lots of natural light as the whole entrance wall is a window. Plus, they've got good twinkle lights indoors! Lots of seating and wow they've got Thai iced tea so 10 pts to gryffindor for them!

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_header: Great study spot if you don't need wifi
review_desc: Nice selection of baked goods and loose leaf tea. Coffee is always great. There isn't any wifi, and it can be hard to find seating. They do have bathrooms, but I wish the standard of cleanliness was higher.

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: Cream Cafe use George Howell Coffee Co. (GHCC) as house roaster, based right in Acton, MA. George Howell is dedicated to delivering the finest quality beans with a passion for freshness and superior taste; you should see this guy at a cupping, he lights up...More

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: Love coming here for breakfast or afternoon tea/coffee. Great selection of teas, delicious cakes and cookies.

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: I found my way here for a late night treat and had an AMAZING glass of iced tea. It tasted like Sleepytime tea, and was really crisp and fresh. Also, an itty bitty pumpkin whoopie pie was tasty and priced appropriately. I did think the...More

type_of_cusine: American, Cafe, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
review_desc: As someone from Melbourne travelling to the US, the issue of where to find a decent coffee is always a concern. Problem solved at Crema Cafe, near Harvard. The best coffee I had for my entire month away. Good cakes, sandwiches and breakfasts.

What's not to like about DD? How about slow service, that's what's not to like. Seems the counter help prefers to mill around the back door and not step out to reduce the line. I much prefer the DD on the corner of Adams St....More

review_header: It's a DD, Just like All the Others
review_desc: Food as expected. Crowded on Saturday about 9 AM. The coffee is good (so says my wife) ands the doughnuts fresh. All you could ask.

This Dunkin Donuts is very handy for commuters, as it's close to a bus stop and the commuter rail. It's small and can be busy.There is metered street parking close by, otherwise there is small parking lot north on Walnut Street.

This is a standard Dunkin Donuts shop offering standard DD fare.
Donuts are always fresh. Sandwiches are not bad. Parking in a
small lot. Very busy in the mornings as most DD's are.

simply your every day Dunkin Donuts. good coffee, average to fair service and same type of service as other DD'S.
nothing special

We refer to this as the bad Starbucks. My apologies to the two employees who work their who are very friendly. My order gets mixed up here frequently, whether I pre-order or order in person. The cashiers seem disgruntled to be there. The woman making...More
If you time your visit badly you can be in for a long wait. It's also quite small, with very limited seating. Otherwise it's like any Starbucks.
Just no breakfast sandwiches. Yes thats heartbreaking because there is a Dunkin Donuts a block away...
I only go to this location once a week I pickup coffee for my daughter and myself. Consistently every week with crabby workers! No personality contest winners!

Good Starbucks. Parking isn't that great in the smallish lot but adequate. Service was very good from the friendly staff on this moderately busy Saturday morning. My Red-eye Dark Roast Coffee was fine.

I'm not a huge fan of Starbucks for many reasons, one being that their baristas usually are too busy to notice you. However, I was in Watertown for only a week and some of these baristas were a friendly face each morning! Hanry, Salem, and...More

review_header: It is a Starbucks. Nothing more or less.
review_desc: Just an average regular Starbucks. Reliable and dependable coffee. Nothing more nothing less. If you want service and creativity go to a real café or a place like Vickie Lees in Belmont.

Such a great experience every time I go here. My coffee is always made perfectly and quickly. The baristas are also sooo nice! As mentioned in a previous review, they really do make the attempt to get to know you. They complete orders timely and...More
Always good to find a Dunkin Donuts. This one did not disappoint - service was fast, the food was good, and we were able to get coffee, tea, a breakfast treat, and be on our way.

This place is very close to my apartment?I almost come here and eat breakfast every day
The ham egg cheese on English muffin is good and worth to try?also iced coffee with cream suguar as well
Easy access but limited parking and NO drive-thru. Wasn't the same service I have gotten at other DD's. The coffee seemed a bit weak and without the great favor.
Dunkin Donuts is always good for a quick egg sandwich breakfast and great coffee too... Pleasant workers..as well

Conveniently located across the street from my hotel and the entrance back onto the Mass Pike, this was just want I wanted and needed as I was preparing to get on the road for three hours. Cappuccino with sugar was exactly that: tasty, strong, sweet,hot,...More

review_header: Coffee and a bite on the run
review_desc: You can count on Dunkin's for quick coffee and a breakfast sandwich when you're on the run. Better quality and often faster than the so-called 'fast food' purveyors. Nice to have a consistent and reliable option!

review_header: Went twice, Mistakes twice, and Manager Attitude Dreadful
review_desc: Went in here twice as it was across from our hotel. On both occasions they forgot part of our order and got part of our order wrong. On the second visit they gave our order to somebody else, (mainly because it was wrong so we...More

review_header: Always a good cup of coffee
review_desc: I really miss the chocolate-covered cakes -- if they brought that back on the menu, I'd give them a 5 rating!.
service was ok coffee was great donutts tasted cold and old if you just want coffee its the place to go if you want a doughnut no good

My Mom and I were looking for a quick place to grab some lunch after church. We decided to give the cafe a try. We were pleasantly surprised by the salad, sandwiches and crepe options. Everything was just what we like order. The food was...More

review_header: Nice little cafe with good food and friendly service
review_desc: This is one of those hidden-in-plain-sight gems. Even though it's right on the main drag of Leonard Street, it's location makes it easy to overlook. My kids love the crepes. The coffee is good and the food is made fresh.

Charming Bellmont Cafe is situated in a tiny building on the main drag of Belmont, a small town about 20 minutes out of Boston. Seating is either at the 6-7 indoor tables or, in good weather, in a very pleasant outdoor patio area. Diners order...More

review_header: Nice little place for a coffee and a bite to eat
review_desc: Had a Nutella crepe and a cappuccino. Both were very well made. The place is very neat and airy, good selection.
Nice little place to stop for a quick bite. They toast their panini with no added fat - a plus. Also in the plus column: Illy coffee, great looking crepes and a large outdoor patio.

If you are looking for a nice cafe and great food, go to Bellmont Caffe and order a yummy coffee and lunch! The owner is wonderful and he gets delicious bagels from Montreal and you will happy with the taste and choice! Lots of sandwiches...More

I had a delicious soup special that made a perfect meal. I am gluten free, and there weren't many options for me, but what I had was lovely. The people I ate with raved about their food. The service was great. The seating is great...More

review_header: Great breakfast spot in Belmont Center
review_desc: A great spot in Belmont Center to get breakfast and very good quality coffee. Wonderful crepes, sandwiches, and bagels. Really nice outdoor patio in nice weather. Highly recommended!

The menu is nice: pannini, crepes, light salads, etc. Nothing extraordinary but it was good. You can take out or eat in place.There isn't much room and it is crowded at lunch time with people camping with their computers and smartphones. They bring the food...More
Good Dunkin Donuts location. Bagel w Cream Cheese was perfectly toasted... service was fast and friendly. What more can you ask? Good parking lot.

No Drive-thru but pretty good parking and you can get in and out quickly. Sometimes the staff struggles to understand English but you can usually get through to them. Coffee is hot. Service is pretty good.

I frequent this Dunkin’ location as it’s convenient on the way to work; the coffee and breakfast sandwiches are generally made well.
However, I felt compelled to write a review about the staff interaction I frequently observe. During many visits, there seems to be conflict...More

My daughter, Anica (age 9) writes: Starbucks is the best coffee shop ever. Starbucks has amazing ice tea and my daughter just loves it. It is a great place to hang out with friends. They have caffeine free drinks that are okay for kids to...More

review_header: I go there every morning. People are friendly and very helpful.
review_desc: I like Starbucks coffee. A lot. To me, it is superior to other coffee shops and I try a lot of them.
This Starbucks is excellent. The staff are always friendly and accommodating. Always a welcoming place!
Nicole is always there with a smile and all employees acre about their job! Fantastic Starbucks! Always clean bathroom and wonderful service for me!
We love the staff and super friendly! Always clean and neat. :) Never a bad place to go and super staff!

The staff are incredibly efficient, and they need to be. This is one of the busiest coffee shops. Your drink is served just the way you want it, as they remember your preferences. Convenient location, next to a public parking lot and a T stop.

review_header: Amazing beverage selections and comfortable seating
review_desc: We arrived at Fleck after an early dinner and the barister happily explained to us what is on the very special menu. The sweet potato cream latte hit the spot on a cold evening. The herb tea menu is something special, with some hand blended...More
Standout friendly service, pleasant urban hipster vibe. I had the afogado, which was delicioso! Great location near the T.
Trendy corner cafe with beautiful espresso coffees & the machine is also gorgeous. Friendly and chatty staff. They also have drip coffees, iced coffees too.

review_header: My go-to for morning and afternoon coffee
review_desc:
Lovely staff and they make fantastic coffee. Their affogato and cappuccinos are excellent. They also have baked goods, some limited ice cream and Lake Champlain chocolate.
The seating area is small, but doesn't feel crowded even when full, it's a fairly chill place inside--very easy...More

review_header: A much needed cup of joe
review_desc: Didn't want to go to any chain-shops, found this online. Gave it a go. Thought it would be packed but only 2 other customers. Better than the other branded name places, I would guess it's close to the best around the area. Like the fact...More
Love it, I think it has the best espresso in Newton. Also its atmosphere is really cool. The morning crew is super friendly. The snacks and oatmeal are great.

I have been here 3 times - the day it opened, once with a friend and once with my husband. The barista really cares about what you want and making it the way you like it. I find it to be more of a real...More

What a delightful little find! Cozy space with comfortable chairs and tables, wonderful baristas who are proud of their creations and fun to talk to. Small food items, lots of coffee options, teas and tea and coffee making equipment. One stop shopping and imbibing! The...More

They do a Lovely cortado here, have very friendly staff and great service. They use square for card payments and you can select printed or emailed receipt etc. it is a nice clean corner coffee bar with limited seating and a few tasty treats

Peets always has great beans. I'm a decaf drinker and there is no place that has decaf beans that are better than peets. You don't feel like you're being cheated by drinking decaf because the decaf beans are so rich. This location was great. Service...More

review_header: Go here often for vanilla latte
review_desc: Roomy coffee house and sometimes it can be crowded. Often over air conditioned so I remember to bring a sweater. Parking lot in back which is good because it can be hard to find parking. I usually get an almond milk vanilla latte, very tasty....More
I have never eaten here, I just come for the coffee, which is my absolute favorite coffee. I also buy beans here to make coffee at home.

Starbucks is one side of the Square and Peet's the other. I chose Peet's thinking the pastries could be better. Looked like a Starbucks display, full of white sugar, fat and flour. The tepid cappuccino, also, was nothing special, and half if it ended up...More

review_header: Free unlimited data Internet cafe that, by the way, serves coffee.

3 of us tried to get a seat here for lunch but found it impossible as, although there were plenty of empty seats, most of the customers occupying seats had their feet up on the empty ones or they bags and laptops spread out across...More
Both coffee and pastries are better. There just aren't enough Peet's stores around! I go out of my way to find one. Just wish there were more outside of Boston area
Looking for something to quench our thirst. The large mocha blend had nice flavor, nice and cold...with lots of whip cream..Loved it!
Whenever I'm in the area I make sure to grab a cup of hot mocha at Peet's in Newton. Their coffee is stronger than Starbucks', and tastes great too.
My 2 daughters and I ate breakfast here before starting our tour of Lexington and Concord. Great selection of coffee, tea, sandwiches, and pastries. Nice atmosphere . Would definitely eat here again

Peet's is always a super choice to stop in and grab a mocha with a friend. The service is fast and friendly. There are choices for some nibbles if you don't mind the indulgent calories. The seating is limited but if you do get a...More

Peet's is a nation wide chain. I usually avoid chains, but I had no choice when I was in Lexington, so Peet's it was.
Lots of coffee/tea choices, nice pastry selections. We each tried a scone and like what we had. Coffee was good, not...More

review_header: Great place to meet for coffee.
review_desc: Better than Starbucks - even though I have been living in Seattle but am originally from Lexington Ma.

Peet's does not disappoint. This Peet's operates at the same high standard as other Peet's. I depend on this place to have my French Roast coffee that I drink every day.... I bring my own with me when I travel. I'm a regular.

Pete's cappuccinos are out of this world. Most of the baristas
make exquisite foam - many with designs on it, such as hearts and leaves. The only drawback is that there is limited seating, so you may have to wait for a table.
Great coffee. Nice ambiance, but can get to crowded (standing room only). Still, it's the only coffee shop in the area that equals or exceeds the quality of the Starbucks (a few doors down).

review_header: Best coffee, nice baristas and nice setting
review_desc: Recently renovated and beautiful, Peet's is definitely a place to hang out, drink awesome coffees and enjoy the specialty drinks. The regulars here give it a caffeinated Cheers style atmosphere. The whip cream is fresh and thick and they offer both almond and soy milks...More
Peet's always offers good coffee and it is great to see that they finally re imaged the outlet which brought a refreshing ambience. More comfortable seating.
People come in and monopolize the few tables with their computers and stay for hours. Most of the time I decide to go there I have to leave because there is no room for 2 people to sit together.
And you get what you expect in terms of products but I found the service a little slow. It's on the large side if you're looking for a place to hang for a while.

review_header: What can you say about Starbucks?
review_desc: It might no be fair to compare this to my local Starbucks but it seems like I always have to wait a bit too long for my drink at this location. The drink quality is the same but that should be a "given" so I'm...More

630 pm on a Sunday, and the place looked like a dump. Mir can't be that busy that somebody can't get a broom and clean up that filthy floor.
If it wasn't a Starbucks, I would have walked out as soon as I entered.
